thread.title: Yreka High Cross Country team at home NAL meet: Lady Miners earn 6th straight top finish
thread.title_full: Yreka High Cross Country team at home NAL meet: Lady Miners earn 6th straight top finish

author: Daily News Sports Editor Bill Choy @SDNBillChoy
title: Yreka High Cross Country team at home NAL meet: Lady Miners earn 6th straight top finish
text: Yreka High Cross Country team at home NAL meet: Lady Miners earn 6th straight top finish Comment By Daily News Sports Editor Bill Choy@SDNBillChoy   By Daily News Sports Editor Bill Choy@SDNBillChoy Posted Oct. 1, 2015 at 1:48 PM By Daily News Sports Editor Bill Choy@SDNBillChoy Posted Oct. 1, 2015 at 1:48 PM YREKA The Yreka High varsity girls cross country team took the top spot at a home Northern Athletic League meet at Lower Greenhorn Park on Wednesday. Yreka, currently the top ranked girls varsity team in the Northern Section, has earned a first place finish in all six races it has competed at this year. The Lady Miners had five runners place in the top 10. Meri Krier came in 2nd, with a time of 20:54.48. The top finisher, Anna Lewis of CentralValley, had a time of 20:49.04. Mallory Ward was 3rd, Lena Fogle 4th, and Lacey Jackson 5th for Yreka. Arianna Brooks came in 7th for the Lady Miners. Head Yreka cross country coach Pam Borg said it was great to see the girls varsity squad win another event on their home course. “It’s where we want to be,” she said. “The girls are all willing to put in the work.” Borg said while the squad is still working on improving each and every race, she said the varsity girls are putting in the effort to perform at a high level. She added that the squad is certainly shooting for NAL and section titles this year and said they understand that they need to keep improving to reach their goals. The Miner varsity boys team came in 2nd. Isaac Fernandez was the top finisher for Yreka with a 3rd place finish. The Yreka girls JV team was 2nd. Madison Restine was 5th and was the top Yreka finisher. Tyler Jones was the top placer for the Yreka JV boys with a 9th place finish. Yreka next runs at the State of Jefferson meet in Ashland, Ore., onSaturday. By Daily News Sports Editor Bill Choy@SDNBillChoy   By Daily News Sports Editor Bill Choy@SDNBillChoy
